title: Electrostatics - charge on string in E-field

content.question: A sphere of charge <math alttext="q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>q</mi></math> and mass <math alttext="m" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>m</mi></math> hangs from a string attached to the ceiling. An electric field is established in the area where the sphere hangs, causing the sphere to move to a new position such that the string makes an angle <math alttext="theta" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>θ</mi></math> with the vertical, as shown in the figure. What is the magnitude of the electric field?

choices.label: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator m g times the tangent of theta, and denominator q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mrow><mi>m</mi><mi>g</mi><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>tan</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>θ</mi></mrow><mi>q</mi></mfrac></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator m g times the sine of theta, and denominator q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mrow><mi>m</mi><mi>g</mi><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>θ</mi></mrow><mi>q</mi></mfrac></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator m g, and denominator q times the cosine of theta, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mrow><mi>m</mi><mi>g</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>q</mi><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>θ</mi></mrow></mfrac></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator m g, and denominator q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mrow><mi>m</mi><mi>g</mi></mrow><mi>q</mi></mfrac></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator m g times the tangent of theta, and denominator q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mrow><mi>m</mi><mi>g</mi><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>tan</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>θ</mi></mrow><mi>q</mi></mfrac></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
